Nikhil,

Here's a case with 577 s exposures, 90% filled at 6 exposures (leading to the depths below -- we should probably use these for forecasts).

Wall clock time is 137 days per 1000 deg^2 for the spectroscopic survey.

The wavelength range used is 1.5-2.4 microns and I assumed 70% completeness.

The tiling pattern is:

Nx      9
Ny      4
deltax  0.2
deltay  0.2
gammax  0.145
gammay  0.145
2 passes at M=2 exposures and 2 passes at M=3 exposures.

Chris
